page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY STROUD
page.content: {EARLY 20TH CENTURY RODBOROUGH: {Road Transport}Horse-drawn charabancs for outings;huge Shires for timber-wagons and brewery drays;first car had solid tyres.{Canals }Coal for gas works in horse-drawn barges.{Rail} Local LMS line with local halts and train called 'Dudbridge donkey'. {Lighting}Oil lamps and candles followed by gas then electricity;gas lamps in streets lit by lamp lighter with hooked stick.{ {Heating and Cooking} 0n open fires with heavy pans and kettles and spits for meat.Later ranges had an oven and water heater.{Clothes }Men wore cloth caps;bowlers were popular with top hats for special occasions.They had white shirts with stiff collars.Clothes were much more formal with long dresses for the ladies and buttoned boots.
